ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version

ElementDescription: When you talk to people, do you have the feeling that they don't understand you?
Notes: 1= Never have this feeling; 7= Always have this feeling

ElementDescription: In the past, when you had to do something which depended upon cooperation with others, did you have the feeling that it:
Notes: 1= Surely wouldn't get done; 7= Surely would get done

ElementDescription: Think of the people with whom you come into contact daily, aside from the ones to whom you feel closest. How well do you know most of them?
Notes: 1= You feel that they are strangers; 7= You feel that you know them very well

ElementDescription: Do you have the feeling that you don't really care about what goes on around you?
Notes: 1= Very seldom; 7= Very often

ElementDescription: Has it happened in the past that you were surprised by the behavior of people whom you thought you knew well?
Notes: 1= Never happened; 7= Always happened

ElementDescription: Has it happened that people whom you counted on disappointed you?
Notes: 1= Never happened; 7= Always happened

ElementDescription: Life is:
Notes: 1= Full of interest; 7= Completely routine

ElementDescription: Until now your life has had:
Notes: 1= No clear goals; 7= Very clear goals

ElementDescription: Do you have the feeling that you're being treated unfairly?
Notes: 1= Very often; 7= Very seldom/Never

ElementDescription: In the past ten years your life has been:
Notes: 1= Full of changes without your knowing what will happen next; 7= Completely consistent and clear

ElementDescription: Most of the things you do in your future will probably be:
Notes: 1= Completely fascinating; 7= Deadly boring

ElementDescription: Do you have the feeling that you are in an unfamiliar situation and don't know what to do:
Notes: 1= Very often; 7= Very seldom/Never

ElementDescription: What best describes how you see life?
Notes: 1= One can always find a solution to painful things in life; 7= There is no solution to painful things in life

ElementDescription: When you think about your life, you very often:
Notes: 1= Feel how good it is to be alive; 7= Ask yourself why you exist at all

ElementDescription: When you face a difficult problem, the choice of a solution is:
Notes: 1= Always confusing and hard to find; 7= Always completely clear

ElementDescription: Doing the things you do every day is:
Notes: 1= A source of deep pleasure and satisfaction; 7= A source of pain and boredom

ElementDescription: Your life in the future will probably be:
Notes: 1= Full of changes without your knowing what will happen next; 7= Completely consistent and clear

ElementDescription: When something unpleasant happened in the past your tendency was:
Notes: 1= "To eat yourself up" about it; 7= To say "Ok, that's that, I have to live with it" and go on

ElementDescription: Do you have very mixed-up feelings and ideas?
Notes: 1= Very often; 7= Very seldom/Never

ElementDescription: When you so something that gives you a good feeling:
Notes: 1= It's certain that you'll go on feeling good; 7= It's certain that something will happen to spoil the feeling

ElementDescription: Does it happen that you have feelings inside you would rather not feel?
Notes: 1= Very often; 7= Very seldom/Never

ElementDescription: You anticipate that your personal life in the future will be:
Notes: 1= Totally without meaning/purpose; 7= Full of meaning and purpose

ElementDescription: Do you think that there will always be people whom you'll be able to count on in the future?
Notes: 1= You're certain there will be; 7= You doubt there will be

ElementDescription: Does it happen that you have the feeling that you don't know exactly what's about to happen?
Notes: 1= Very often; 7= Very seldom/Never

ElementDescription: Many people - even those with a strong character - sometimes feel like losers in certain situations. How often have you felt this way in the past?
Notes: 1= Never/Very seldom; 7= Very often

ElementDescription: When something happened, have you generally found that:
Notes: 1= You over- or underestimated its importance; 7= You saw things in the right proportions

ElementDescription: When you think of the difficulties you are likely to face in important aspects of your life, do you have the feeling that:
Notes: 1= You will always succeed in overcoming the difficulties; 7= You won't succeed in overcoming the difficulties

ElementDescription: How often do you have the feeling that there's little meaning in the things you do in your daily life?
Notes: 1= Very often; 7= Very seldom/Never

ElementDescription: How often do you have feelings that you're not sure you can keep under control?
Notes: 1= Very often; 7= Very seldom/Never

ElementDescription: Sense of Coherence Scale (SOC) 29-item score
Sense of Coherence Scale (SOC) 13-item score
Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
